jobs.title: Software Engineer Intern, Backend
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary

Note: we are open to fall, winter, and spring internships.


As a Software Engineer at Arcade, you will work across our backend and AI systems to power the real-time, intelligent workflows that bring generative creation to life. You will own critical infrastructure, from model orchestration to caching layers to inference pipelines, and partner closely with AI research, product, and design to launch entirely new user experiences.


This role is for systems-minded builders who care about performance, reliability, and clarity. You will move quickly, work collaboratively, and ship ambitious products that define new creative possibilities. You’ll be joining a fast-moving, highly technical team where engineers ship bold ideas quickly and own them end-to-end.

What You'll Do

  • Design and build scalable backend systems for model execution, prompt orchestration, agentic workflows, and real-time inference

  • Own infrastructure for core user actions, including API design, job queues, caching, observability, and deployment

  • Collaborate across AI research, product, and design to bring new capabilities into production

  • Build core primitives for text-to-product creation, such as model pipelines, tool integrations, retrieval flows, and evaluation frameworks

  • Continuously improve performance, latency, and stability across inference-heavy systems

  • Contribute to a high-trust, high-velocity engineering culture

We're Looking for Engineers Who

  • Have strong backend and infrastructure foundations and enjoy building fast, reliable systems

  • Have experience owning production systems that interact with real users or real-world data

  • Are excited about generative AI and have worked with LLMs, agent frameworks, vector search, or multimodal tools

  • Move quickly from prototype to production and thrive in high-agency environments

  • Care about product quality and user experience, even when working deep in the stack

  • Bring energy, taste, and humility to everything they do

What You Bring

  • Currently in school with a background in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a similar field

  • Experience building and scaling backend systems in production

  • Proficiency with Python and backend frameworks such as Django or FastAPI

  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure tools like GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, and Pub/Sub

  • Hands-on experience with LLM pipelines, model orchestration, or prompt tooling in production or personal projects

  • Strong debugging, performance tuning, and system design skills

  • Bonus: experience at early-stage startups, with generative AI products, or in creative tooling

Additional

Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events


Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.title: Director of Product Management
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary: 


To create a magical experience for our customer, we have to do a lot: create an image that is exactly what a customer dreams of, provide price and dimensions, and produce a faithful physical product — all while doing our best to make a complex and intimidating system feel simple, accessible, and human. The Director of Product Management will play a pivotal role at the company in its 0-1 journey as it redefines commerce and defines the first AI experience for many consumers worldwide.


Arcade seeks an entrepreneurial, creative, hands-on and highly experienced individual who wants to break convention and take on what others think is ‘impossible’, in order to build the future of e-commerce. Together, we will create a category-defining company - the world’s first prompt-to-product marketplace - which will take its place amongst the world’s biggest e-commerce destinations. Critical to success is keeping up pace to build moat, achieve first-mover advantage, and scale to meet what the market demands.  


The Director of Product Management will be responsible for driving the strategy, design, and build of our site experience, including the AI-driven product creation flow, shopping features (both pre-order and post-order), and maker-facing features including fulfillment and customer service functionality. This leader will ensure a best-in-class marketplace user-centric product building experience. S/he will partner closely with our engineering, design, marketing, and content production team members to prioritize and implement key functionality. The successful candidate will have had deep PM experience in building delightful and viral products, strong project management skills, superb and proactive communications skills, the ability to motivate cross-functional teams,the ability to hold their own in technical conversations, and the ability to drive detail-oriented results on time.


This role is an opportunity for a highly entrepreneurial, hands-on, positive, and strategic individual to build a category-defining company surrounded by superb peers and interacting with iconic investors.


The role requires working in our sunny Presidio, SF office 4 days/week. 

Responsibilities

  • Partner closely with the company’s S-Team to develop and communicate weekly priorities

  • Define and execute product strategy that delivers a best-in-class product creation and ecommerce experience while driving innovations that set the standard for the first AI generated product company

  • Evangelize customer-centric thinking and strategies to deliver high consumer NPS and conversion to purchase 

  • Oversee e-commerce platform’s architecture, vendor selection, integrations, and site performance in partnership with the Head of Engineering 

  • Own the shopping user experience in conjunction with our Head of Design 

  • Partner with engineering team in managing sprint planning and implementation to ensure consistent, impactful releases of new features 

  • Make data-driven decisions to rapidly test and iterate on product hypotheses. Develop, monitor, and manage key commerce, SEO, social, and site metrics

  • Build tools on our Retool backend tools platform themselves: Component layout, light SQL. Ability to reach out to engineering for assistance when necessary, but largely make progress on this front without taxing engineering bandwidth

  • Project manage weekly sprints, communicating clearly and proactively with cross-functional partners

Qualifications

  • 7+ years of experience in product management in a consumer e-commerce or social company, including previous experience at the Director level

  • Experience required in building consumer-facing features and ideally, backend commerce features - fulfillment, operations, customer service and other post-order features

  • Experience launching and scaling products with network effects and UGC driven content 

  • Familiarity with eCommerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, BigCommerce, CommerceTools, etc), and third-party applications

  • Demonstrated success in driving core commerce metrics such as NPS, conversion rates, organic traffic growth, and viral engagement 

  • Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

  • Sense of urgency in delivering impactful products to the consumer with uncompromising quality 

  • Experience with multi-sided marketplace companies and platforms a plus

  • Basic SQL skills required. Rudimentary Javascript skills a plus but not required

  • Familiarity with generative AI along with a growth mindset to continuously to learn about new technologies Arcade can leverage

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws.

jobs.title: Research Engineer Intern, Applied AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary


Note: we are open to fall, winter, and spring internships.


As a Research Engineer at Arcade, you will work on the frontier of generative AI, building the models, pipelines, and infrastructure that power real-time creativity. This role blends hands-on experimentation with deep systems thinking to bring new generative techniques from research to production. 


You’ll train small, domain-specific models, prototype new workflows across LLMs and diffusion architectures, and ship them directly into features used by real users. You’ll collaborate closely with AI research, product, and engineering to develop novel capabilities and bring them to life in production. And you’ll be part of a small, high-agency team where people ship fast, own their ideas end-to-end, and help shape entirely new modes of interaction.

What You'll Do

  • Train, fine-tune, and evaluate generative models across text, image, and multimodal inputs

  • Develop model pipelines for domain-specific tasks, including LLM-based tools, text-to-image generation, and multi-agent workflows

  • Design internal tools and infrastructure to prototype, benchmark, and iterate on models efficiently

  • Run structured evaluations across prompts, retrieval methods, generation quality, and UX performance

  • Work closely with engineering and product teams to integrate experimental models into production systems

  • Monitor and improve deployed models in production, focusing on performance, stability, and user impact

  • Stay up to date with advances in generative AI and apply the best ideas pragmatically in a high-velocity environment

We're Looking For Research Engineers Who

  • Build with intent and rigor, and care about performance, structure, and design at every layer

  • Have experience training and deploying generative models, especially LLMs or diffusion architectures

  • Enjoy debugging prompts, fine-tuning weights, testing loss curves, and optimizing inference

  • Move fluidly between rapid experimentation and shipping robust, user-facing features

  • Thrive in high-agency environments with fast iteration cycles and high technical ownership

  • Communicate clearly and work effectively across technical and cross-functional teams

What You Bring

  • Currently in school with a background in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a similar field

  • Must be available to start sometime between January and August 2026

  • Strong Python experience and fluency with machine learning libraries such as PyTorch or TensorFlow

  • Familiarity with model training and fine-tuning on domain-specific or custom datasets

  • Experience with retrieval systems, prompt design, evaluation frameworks, or embedding workflows

  • Understanding of model deployment and performance tuning in production environments

  • Bonus: experience with multi-agent systems, generative UX design, or production LLM pipelines

Additional

Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events


Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.title: New Category Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary: 


To become the destination marketplace for people to “turn your thoughts into things”, we must have broad category coverage and liquidity. Arcade will constantly redefine and expand the possibilities of what can be co-created with AI and makers. The New Category Product Manager is responsible for partnering with cross-functional teams to define and execute on new product verticals for the company. 


This role will partner closely with the senior leadership team, supply chain, merchandising, and marketing to understand consumer demand and category requirements. The role will collaborate with UX and engineering teams to bring the category to life. 


An ideal profile for this role is entrepreneurial, detail-oriented, positive, and adept at driving cross-functional workstreams. An ideal candidate has prior PM and/or e-commerce experience and is ready to build a category-defining company surrounded by superb peers and interacting with iconic investors.


The role requires working in our sunny Presidio, SF office 4 days/week.

Responsibilities

  • Define new category strategy with the company’s senior leadership team, aligning overall Arcade business goals and customer needs  

  • Build and manage comprehensive new category roll out roadmap and priorities 

  • Design and implement a scalable and repeatable framework for category launches, including operational processes and software tooling 

  • Partner with category managers and supply chain team to define technology and AI category requirements unique to each category

  • Define differentiated value propositions in each category and associated Arcade product requirements 

  • Drive implementation of roadmap through partnering with designers to craft smooth user experiences and engineering teams to move concepts quickly to market 

  • Partner with marketing team to craft resonate consumer facing messaging and channel strategies 

  • Set aggressive timeline and ensure disciplined execution to achieve Arcade’s ambitious category goals 

Qualifications

  • 4+ years of product management experience in a high growth environment or a general management role for an e-commerce category or brand

  • Exceptional project management skills with demonstrated ability to manage complex, cross-functional initiatives with high interdependencies 

  • Strong business acumen and analytical skills 

  • Ability to translate ambiguity into structured action plans and rally teams around implementation of plan 

  • High curiosity in learning about new product categories and production processes 

  • Strong collaborator and communicator 

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws.

The New Category Product Manager is responsible for partnering with cross-functional teams to define and execute on new product verticals for the company. 




This role will partner closely with the senior leadership team, supply chain, merchandising, and marketing to understand consumer demand and category requirements. The role will collaborate with UX and engineering teams to bring the category to life. 




An ideal profile for this role is entrepreneurial, detail-oriented, positive, and adept at driving cross-functional workstreams. An ideal candidate has prior PM and/or e-commerce experience and is ready to build a category-defining company surrounded by superb peers and interacting with iconic investors.




The role requires working in our sunny Presidio, SF office 4 days/week.

Responsibilities

 - Define new category strategy with the company’s senior leadership team, aligning overall Arcade business goals and customer needs  

 - Build and manage comprehensive new category roll out roadmap and priorities 

 - Design and implement a scalable and repeatable framework for category launches, including operational processes and software tooling 

 - Partner with category managers and supply chain team to define technology and AI category requirements unique to each category

 - Define differentiated value propositions in each category and associated Arcade product requirements 

 - Drive implementation of roadmap through partnering with designers to craft smooth user experiences and engineering teams to move concepts quickly to market 

 - Partner with marketing team to craft resonate consumer facing messaging and channel strategies 

 - Set aggressive timeline and ensure disciplined execution to achieve Arcade’s ambitious category goals 

Qualifications

 - 4+ years of product management experience in a high growth environment or a general management role for an e-commerce category or brand

 - Exceptional project management skills with demonstrated ability to manage complex, cross-functional initiatives with high interdependencies 

 - Strong business acumen and analytical skills 

 - Ability to translate ambiguity into structured action plans and rally teams around implementation of plan 

 - High curiosity in learning about new product categories and production processes 

 - Strong collaborator and communicator 

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.




Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Intern, Frontend - Winter 2025
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary


Note: we are open to fall, winter, and spring internships.


As a Software Engineer Intern, Frontend at Arcade, you will build user-facing experiences in Next.js and TypeScript that bring generative creation to life. You will own core web UI architecture, from design system components to data-fetching and rendering, and partner closely with AI research, product, and design to launch entirely new user experiences. This role is for product and performance minded frontend builders who care about accessibility, design quality, and speed. You will move quickly, work collaboratively, and ship ambitious products that define new creative possibilities. You’ll be joining a fast-moving, highly technical team where engineers ship bold ideas quickly and own them end-to-end.

What You'll Do

  • Design and build scalable frontend features in Next.js/TypeScript, including SSR/ISR, routing, and edge-aware data fetching

  • Develop and maintain a reusable design system and component library; ensure accessibility (WCAG) and responsive layouts

  • Implement real-time, AI-powered UX (streaming UIs, optimistic updates, background tasks) with robust state management

  • Collaborate across backend/AI, product, and design to integrate new capabilities into polished, manufacturable product flows

  • Optimize performance (Core Web Vitals), bundle size, caching, and client/server rendering paths

  • Add thoughtful instrumentation, experiments, and UI quality gates (analytics, A/B tests, error and latency tooling)

  • Contribute to a high-trust, high-velocity engineering culture

We’re Looking Engineers Who

  • Have strong frontend foundations (TypeScript, React/Next.js) and enjoy crafting fast, reliable user interfaces

  • Have experience owning production systems that interact with real users or real-world data

  • Are excited about generative AI in the UI and have worked with LLM-powered features, multimodal inputs, or retrieval-backed experiences

  • Move quickly from prototype to production and thrive in high-agency environments

  • Care deeply about design details, accessibility, and user experience

  • Bring energy, taste, and humility to everything they do

What You Bring

  • Currently in school with a background in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a similar field

  • Must be available to start sometime between January and August 2026

  • Experience building and scaling web frontends in production

  • Proficiency with TypeScript, React, and Next.js (App Router preferred)

  • Familiarity with styling approaches (CSS Modules/Tailwind), component composition, and design tokens

  • Experience with testing and reliability for frontend (Jest, React Testing Library, Playwright or Cypress)

  • Understanding of data fetching and caching (React Query/SWR), API integration, and edge runtimes (e.g., Vercel/GCP)

  • Hands-on experience shipping AI-powered UI features or integrating with model-driven APIs

  • Strong debugging, performance tuning, and frontend system design skills

  • Bonus: experience at early-stage startups, with generative AI products, or in creative tooling

Additional


Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events


Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary


As a Software Engineer at Arcade, you will work across our backend and AI systems to power the real-time, intelligent workflows that bring generative creation to life. You will own critical infrastructure, from model orchestration to caching layers to inference pipelines, and partner closely with AI research, product, and design to launch entirely new user experiences.


This role is for systems-minded builders who care about performance, reliability, and clarity. You will move quickly, work collaboratively, and ship ambitious products that define new creative possibilities. You’ll be joining a fast-moving, highly technical team where engineers ship bold ideas quickly and own them end-to-end.

What You'll Do

  • Design and build scalable backend systems for model execution, prompt orchestration, agentic workflows, and real-time inference

  • Own infrastructure for core user actions, including API design, job queues, caching, observability, and deployment

  • Collaborate across AI research, product, and design to bring new capabilities into production

  • Build core primitives for text-to-product creation, such as model pipelines, tool integrations, retrieval flows, and evaluation frameworks

  • Continuously improve performance, latency, and stability across inference-heavy systems

  • Contribute to a high-trust, high-velocity engineering culture

We're Looking For Engineers Who

  • Have strong backend and infrastructure foundations and enjoy building fast, reliable systems

  • Have experience owning production systems that interact with real users or real-world data

  • Are excited about generative AI and have worked with LLMs, agent frameworks, vector search, or multimodal tools

  • Move quickly from prototype to production and thrive in high-agency environments

  • Care about product quality and user experience, even when working deep in the stack

  • Bring energy, taste, and humility to everything they do

What You Bring

  • A background in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a similar field

  • Must be available to start sometime between January and August 2026

  • Experience building and scaling backend systems in production

  • Proficiency with Python and backend frameworks such as Django or FastAPI

  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure tools like GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, and Pub/Sub

  • Hands-on experience with LLM pipelines, model orchestration, or prompt tooling in production or personal projects

  • Strong debugging, performance tuning, and system design skills

  • Bonus: experience at early-stage startups, with generative AI products, or in creative tooling

Additional

Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events


Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.title: Founder Associate, Office of the CEO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary


Note: must be able to start by Fall 2025. 


Founders and future founders: the Office of the CEO, Founder Associate role at Arcade is a special one-of-a-kind high-leverage, high-velocity opportunity at the heart of Arcade’s company-building engine. You’ll work directly with our founder and CEO to tackle the company’s highest-priority strategic and operational challenges, from product to growth to fundraising. You’ll have a front-row seat and real ownership over the systems, experiments, and tools that power our next stage. This is the role for an entrepreneur, someone obsessed with solving messy problems, moving fast, and building things that work. You'll be embedded in the most critical decisions across the company and be expected to execute like a founder: no hand-holding, no red tape, just bias for action and clarity of thought. You’ll play a foundational role in helping Arcade invent a new paradigm for how physical products are imagined, designed, and bought. This is your chance to help define the future of commerce at the intersection of frontier AI and consumer experience for years to come.

What You'll Do

  • Lead and own cross-functional initiatives across product, growth, internal systems, and company strategy

  • Design and build internal tools, scripts, dashboards, and automations that increase team velocity

  • Partner with the CEO on strategic projects, product roadmap design, fundraising prep, investor memos, and board materials

  • Unblock internal bottlenecks, from recruiting to execution, with fast, scrappy systems and scalable solutions

  • Drive Arcade’s operating cadence: team meetings, internal comms, company-wide goal setting, and tracking

  • Research best-in-class consumer experiences, AI trends, and competitor moves, and synthesize them into action

  • Prototype workflows, tools, and dashboards using Python, SQL, Notion, Zapier, Clay, Linear, Airtable, etc

  • Shape the foundation of a new kind of e-commerce company built on AI and creative ownership

What We're Looking For

  • A technical generalist and visionary with strong product taste and a bias for action

  • Someone who thrives in high-context, high-speed environments and wants to operate across product, systems, people, and ops

  • A proactive and strategic communicator who can distill complexity for leadership and teammates

  • A curious and humble operator who values craftsmanship, velocity, and real-world impact

  • A hands-on builder with founder energy and execution muscle

What You Bring

  • Must be able to start sometime very soon: preferably by Fall 2025

  • A product-minded, systems-oriented brain with exceptional execution

  • Experience sourcing, customizing, or building internal or cross-functional tools

  • Fluency in Python or SQL for analytics and tool-building

  • Ability to ship fast using APIs and automation platforms (Zapier, Clay, Notion, etc.)

  • Strong writing and communication across functions

  • Track record of owning outcomes, not just participating in them

  • Bonus: prior founder, early-stage PM or engineer, startup operator, or investor

Additional


Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events


Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.descriptionPlain:
About Arcade




Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.




We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.




Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.




Role Summary




Note: we are open to fall, winter, and spring internships.




As a Software Engineer Intern, Frontend at Arcade, you will build user-facing experiences in Next.js and TypeScript that bring generative creation to life. You will own core web UI architecture, from design system components to data-fetching and rendering, and partner closely with AI research, product, and design to launch entirely new user experiences. This role is for product and performance minded frontend builders who care about accessibility, design quality, and speed. You will move quickly, work collaboratively, and ship ambitious products that define new creative possibilities. You’ll be joining a fast-moving, highly technical team where engineers ship bold ideas quickly and own them end-to-end.

What You'll Do

 - Design and build scalable frontend features in Next.js/TypeScript, including SSR/ISR, routing, and edge-aware data fetching

 - Develop and maintain a reusable design system and component library; ensure accessibility (WCAG) and responsive layouts

 - Implement real-time, AI-powered UX (streaming UIs, optimistic updates, background tasks) with robust state management

 - Collaborate across backend/AI, product, and design to integrate new capabilities into polished, manufacturable product flows

 - Optimize performance (Core Web Vitals), bundle size, caching, and client/server rendering paths

 - Add thoughtful instrumentation, experiments, and UI quality gates (analytics, A/B tests, error and latency tooling)

 - Contribute to a high-trust, high-velocity engineering culture

We’re Looking Engineers Who

 - Have strong frontend foundations (TypeScript, React/Next.js) and enjoy crafting fast, reliable user interfaces

 - Have experience owning production systems that interact with real users or real-world data

 - Are excited about generative AI in the UI and have worked with LLM-powered features, multimodal inputs, or retrieval-backed experiences

 - Move quickly from prototype to production and thrive in high-agency environments

 - Care deeply about design details, accessibility, and user experience

 - Bring energy, taste, and humility to everything they do

What You Bring

 - Currently in school with a background in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a similar field

 - Must be available to start sometime between January and August 2026

 - Experience building and scaling web frontends in production

 - Proficiency with TypeScript, React, and Next.js (App Router preferred)

 - Familiarity with styling approaches (CSS Modules/Tailwind), component composition, and design tokens

 - Experience with testing and reliability for frontend (Jest, React Testing Library, Playwright or Cypress)

 - Understanding of data fetching and caching (React Query/SWR), API integration, and edge runtimes (e.g., Vercel/GCP)

 - Hands-on experience shipping AI-powered UI features or integrating with model-driven APIs

 - Strong debugging, performance tuning, and frontend system design skills

 - Bonus: experience at early-stage startups, with generative AI products, or in creative tooling

Additional




Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events




Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.title: Senior Merchandising Consultant, Home Decor
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.

Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Role Summary:


Arcade is seeking an experienced, creative and execution-focused Senior Merchandising Consultant to help with the growth of its home decor business. This role will be central to how customers experience Arcade — from launching new categories, new makers and AI models to supporting marketing.


The ideal candidate has a sharp eye for design, fluency in digital merchandising, product development experience and experience working with product designers, manufacturers, and vendors. This is a short-term, full-time contract role suited for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment and is energized by working at the intersection of aesthetics, commerce, and technology.


This is a hybrid role (4 days per week on-site) at Arcade’s office in the Presidio, San Francisco.


Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in product development and merchandising in home decor categories, aligning product strategy with brand vision, customer data, and seasonal trends.

  • Assist in onboarding new artisans and brands in home decorPartner with external stakeholders to develop new product lines, shaping assortment, pricing, and trend direction.

  • Collaborate with engineering on AI models.

  • Contribute to product experimentation cycles, providing merchandising hypotheses and insights based on performance data.

Qualifications

  • 7+ years of experience in merchandising, with a particular emphasis on home decor.

  • Previous experience in home decor product development and sourcing.

  • Prior work at a design-forward or luxury brand.

  • Strong visual taste and ability to independently merchandise across style aesthetics and price tiers.

  • Experience managing vendor or designer relationships to develop new products or collections.

  • Comfortable operating independently and prioritizing work in a fast-paced, early-stage environment.

Nice to have!

  • Exposure to AI/ML tools in a merchandising or product recommendation context.

  • Existing relationships with influencer agencies, stylists, or interior designers.

  • Experience in PR or event-based merchandising (e.g., for showrooms, pop-ups, launch events).

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws.

jobs.title: AI Applied Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.

Role Summary

  • We are looking for a highly skilled AI Applied Scientist to advance our generative AI capabilities, with a focus on improving the outputs of diffusion and multi-modal transformer models to meet consumer product needs across many dimensions, from resolution to faithfulness and more. This role will be instrumental in shaping how AI transforms commerce.

  • As a key member of our AI team, you will conduct cutting-edge research, prototype new AI models, and develop new modes of consumer interaction with AI. Your work will drive how users interact with and leverage AI at Arcade. Beyond technical contributions, you will keep the team at the forefront of AI advancements, ensuring we integrate the latest research into our products.

  • This role blends deep technical research, product thinking, and hands-on implementation, requiring someone who thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

  • This is a hybrid role (3-4 days per week on-site) at Arcade’s office in the Presidio, San Francisco.

  • Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and evaluate novel generative AI models and high-resolution image models, including training, image generation, and editing, inclusive of both diffusion-based and transformer-based techniques.

  • Develop and deploy multi-modal architectures that combine vision, language, and structured data for AI-powered product creation.

  • Stay ahead of emerging AI advancements, ensuring Arcade remains at the cutting edge of generative AI and computer vision.

  • Implement and maintain automated training pipelines for scalable experimentationBuild AI-driven internal tools that improve efficiency, automation, monitoring and content generation.

  • Deploy AI models into production, ensuring they are optimized for real-world applications.

  • Optimize AI models for scalability, reliability, and performance in production environments.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI into consumer-facing products for seamless user experiences.


This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of research, engineering, and product innovation, ensuring AI advancements translate into real-world impact at Arcade.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field (Master’s or PhD preferred).

  • Builds and is in active contact with network of applied AI scientists and engineers.

  • Research experience in AI/ML, with a focus on diffusion models and computer vision.

  • Demonstrated experience applying generative models in production / commercial applications, including the orchestration layers and pipeline architecture needed to successfully use models to solve problems, and the deploying, monitoring, and iterating of models in production.

  • Experience with diffusion models, transformers, flow-matching techniques, and multimodal architectures (e.g., Janus, LlaVA, Qwen Omni)

  • Product-minded and creative; able to move fluidly between research and implementation.

  • Strong understanding of ML concepts, algorithms, and model evaluation, both theoretical and applied.

  • Demonstrated ability to keep up with the latest AI developments, including a strong understanding of the model landscape and alignment with Arcade’s goals.

  • Proficient in Python, deep learning frameworks,  and cloud-based AI deployment

  • Experience with big data, distributed computing, and scalable AI pipelines.

  • Hands-on experience in building and optimizing production-ready AI pipelines.

  • Ability to work with large-scale datasets, including data acquisition, preprocessing, and augmentation.

  • Strong attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

  • Excellent communication skills, comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws.

jobs.title: Manager, Supply Chain and Product Quality
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.

Role Summary

  • We are looking for a highly entrepreneurial, strategic Manager to build bespoke supply chain solutions and strategic relationships with Arcade’s key suppliers in existing and new categories.

  • This role requires a customer-centric approach to product quality, where every order shipped must meet or exceed expectations.

  • You will partner with Engineering and AI to meet the company’s category expansion goals (both launching new categories as well as completing recently launched categories).

  • This role requires cross-functional partnership to understand how product manufacturability intersects with Arcade’s AI capabilities. Responsibilities will require creative thinking and hands-on implementation, requiring someone who thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

  • This is a hybrid role (4-5 days per week on-site) at Arcade’s office in the Presidio, San Francisco.

  • This role will require significant international travel, in some cases being on the road for 2 or more consecutive weeks

Responsibilities

  • Build a network of high-quality supply chain partners (finished product manufacturers, component suppliers, etc.) to support Arcade’s current categories and upcoming new category launches.

  • Establish operational policies and processes that deliver on key supply chain goals including high quality product, order timeliness and low cost.

  • Articulate the Arcade value proposition and vision to potential makers and suppliers in meetings, trade shows and other forums.

  • Creatively research sources/communities of makers from which Arcade can source and recruit.

  • Ensure timely follow up with potential makers to keep onboarding and category expansion on track.

  • Negotiate costs with makers to ensure competitive pricing.

  • Continuously manage costing to align with Arcade pricing strategies and to mitigate against macroeconomic challenges.

  • Establish Quality Control standards and processes for each category and ensure processes are being adhered to.

  • Regularly review customer feedback, NPS and product quality scores to improve quality performance across all makers.

  • Monitor production schedules and orders to ensure timeliness of delivery to customers.

  • Proactively communicate progress against goals and risks to successful goal completion to key company stakeholders.

  • Order and manage product samples required for category launch activities including AI requirements and photo shoots.

  • Drive value-add supply chain projects (e.g., sampling/strike offs, packaging development, returns, reduced delivery times, etc.) as directed by management.

  • This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of physical product development, maker relationships, business process and data, ensuring Arcade’s supply chain remains a competitive advantage and translates into real-world impact at Arcade.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s in Business, Operations, Supply Chain or Liberal Arts.

  • Hands-on experience with vendor and supplier sourcing.

  • Hands-on experience with product development and manufacturing.

  • Demonstrated experience building a bespoke supply chain for a brand or company.

  • Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset and proven experience of resourcefulness and creative problem solving related to building bespoke supply chains.

  • Proven track record of defining standard operating procedures (SOPs) and creating scalable, repeatable business processes.

  • Direct experience working across multiple functional areas, especially AI and engineering.

  • Strong attention to detail, ability to anticipate challenges and problem-solving skills.

  • Excellent communication skills, comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.

  • Experience working with international contract manufacturing vendors preferred.

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws

Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


About the role


Arcade seeks a highly entrepreneurial full stack software engineer who leans front-end and will help experiment with key user experiences at top of the funnel in the Arcade AI app.


You are flexible and focused on quick iteration and passionate about user experience. You are also adept at taking product requirements and building out delightful experiences.

Technical Requirements

  • React JS and Next.js Framework

  • Serverless Next.JS

  • Type Safety: TypeScript

  • Django, Python

  • GraphQL/PostGres RDBMS

Qualifications

  • Ability to write clean, reusable code

  • Solid design skills

  • Great communication

  • Collaborative mindset

  • Have 7-9 years full stack development experience

  • Vercel experience and hosted serverless JS

  • Experienced writing test suites, unit tests, and end to end, testable JavaScript code

  • Startup experience

  • Technical leadership experience

This position reports to the Engineering Manager, and requires 5 days per week onsite in the San Francisco office. Competitive salary, equity options, and comprehensive benefits package.


What Makes This Role Exciting 🎯

Agile startup with great potential for high growth.

Be part of AI in real world goods.

Work with a product and design to create rapid iteration of ideas.

There are many opportunities to leverage your expertise and expand your skillsets with this early stage company.


Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Arcade is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and will consider all qualified applicants for employment in accordance with all state, local, and federal laws.

jobs.title: Applied AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Arcade


Arcade is building the world’s first AI physical product creation platform, where imagination becomes reality. Our platform lets anyone design, purchase, and sell custom, manufacturable products using natural language and generative AI. We believe everyone should have the power to create physical goods as easily as they post online, and we’re building the infrastructure to make that real.


We’ve raised $42M from a world-class group of investors, including Reid Hoffman, Forerunner Ventures (Kirsten Green), Canaan Partners (Laura Chau), Adverb Ventures (April Underwood), Factorial Funds (Sol Bier), Offline Ventures (Brit Morin), Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher), Inspired Capital (Alexa von Tobel), and Torch Capital (Jonathan Keidan). Our angel investors include Elad Gil, Ev Williams, Marissa Mayer, Sara Beykpour, Kayvon Beykpour, Anna Veronika Dorogush, Eugenia Kuyda, David Luan, Sharon Zhou, Kelly Wearstler, Karlie Kloss, Colin Kaepernick, Christy Turlington Burns, and Jeff Wilke.


Arcade is headquartered in San Francisco’s Presidio and led by serial entrepreneur Mariam Naficy (Minted, Eve), and a founding team with deep experience in generative AI, design systems, and supply chain. We’re pioneering a new category at the intersection of AI, personal expression, and on-demand manufacturing, and we’re building fast.


Overview of Role


We are seeking an Applied AI Engineer to join our growing team and help advance our generative AI capabilities. This role blends hands-on model development with integration of cutting-edge AI techniques into production systems. You’ll contribute to research, model experimentation, and implementation working closely with cross-functional teams to bring AI-driven products to life.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with engineering and product teams to train and fine-tune machine learning models, including diffusion models, LLMs, and other emerging generative architectures

  • Develop tools and pipelines that support scalable, efficient, and production-ready AI systems

  • Collect, clean, and analyze large-scale datasets to improve model performance and reliability

  • Deploy and maintain AI models in production environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency

  • Design and deploy text-to-image models and LLM-based applications, including advanced prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and multi-component workflows

  • Maintain and monitor deployed models in cloud-based production environments

  • Stay current with developments in generative AI, contribute to the research environment, and apply new developments to enhance pipeline performance

  • Communicate technical concepts clearly across technical and non-technical audiences

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, AI/ML, or a related field

  • Strong proficiency in Python and familiarity with Linux environments; hands-on experience with machine learning libraries like PyTorch, TensorFlow,, etc.

  • Strong fundamentals in machine learning concepts, with a deep understanding of algorithms and their underlying mechanics ("under the hood")

  • Familiarity with training, fine-tuning, and evaluating models, especially with large-scale datasets

  • Familiarity with data preprocessing, cleaning, and feature engineering

  • Awareness of recent developments in generative AI, diffusion models, and LLMs

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and deploying AI models in cloud-based environments

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical thinking skills with close attention to detail

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Additional

Competitive compensation

Lunch provided daily

Company events


Arcade is an equal opportunity employer. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and supportive team, and to creating a platform where anyone, anywhere, can make something meaningful.

jobs.title: Director of Finance & Strategy
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re looking for a dynamic founding operator to join Arcade as our Head of Finance & Strategy and be critical connective tissue on our team. On the one hand a great strategist but on the other hand a scrappy entrepreneur, you’ll be the key right-hand financial and strategic partner to the CEO—shaping our business model and culture, acting as a key strategic sounding board to our CEO, owning operations tasks and functions, entirely owning our finance function, and driving cross- functional business execution.

This role is ideal for someone with a strong foundation in finance and strategy—someone who has worked in top-tier consulting and finance environments and is now eager to apply those skills to build something real, fast-moving, and impactful. You’ll need to be just as comfortable in a spreadsheet as you are in a cross-functional team meeting, and just as interested in market sizing and GTM experiments as in performing entry-level HR and finance tasks.

WHAT YOU’LL GET TO DO

  • Strategic Finance. As the only finance member of our team, you’ll own strategic finance, investor relations, financial projections and forecasts, fundraising, cap table management and setting budgets for each member of the leadership team.

  • Corporate Strategy. Work hand-in-hand with the CEO to define the strategic roadmap, shape our commercial vision, and ensure we’re focused on the highest-leverage opportunities.

  • Business & Revenue Model Development. Play a lead role in developing and evolving Arcade’s revenue model, pricing strategy, and GTM motion. Help the company validate traction and prepare for Series B fundraising. Own and drive key rollouts of business strategy.

  • Business Development. Own sales and partnership work for the company, including driving all contracts and negotiations.

  • Operational Excellence. Own all core administrative functions—including Finance, HR, Legal, and Facilities—overseeing a team of fractional contractors to get the job done.

  • Fundraising Support. Own key components of our board and investor communications. Help prepare materials for future fundraising, especially our upcoming Series B.

  • Cross-Functional Leadership. Act as a project manager across the company. You’ll work closely with Marketing, Product, and Creative teams to execute experiments, follow-up with colleagues to drive outcomes, measure outcomes, and refine strategies in real time.

  • Vendor & Partner Management. Build relationships with key vendors, consultants, and partners across finance, HR, and legal to keep the business running smoothly.

  • Hiring Strategy & Team Planning. Partner with leadership to map future headcount needs, define org structure, and drive an operationally sound hiring plan.

WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT

QUALIFICATIONS

  • You’re a builder at heart: scrappy, fast-moving, and energized by the opportunity to wear many hats in a high-impact role. You’re willing to own whatever needs to be owned, no task too small—from writing team communications each week to helping drive team outings—side-by-side with the CEO.

  • You're a swiss army knife operator who thrives in ambiguity and can context-switch effectively between different functions.

  • You're fascinated by the intersection of AI and creative expression.

  • You have 3–8 years of experience in strategy and finance. Experience in investment banking, corporate finance, venture capital, private equity, or other financial role required.

  • An MBA is preferred.

  • Previous experience in business operations or general management roles, ideally with direct P&L ownership or GM responsibilities.

  • You have deep familiarity with consumer marketplaces or e-commerce platforms, and an understanding of what it takes to build both the supply and demand sides of a consumer product.

  • You are highly data-driven and analytical—comfortable building models, crafting dashboards, and distilling data into insights. You use metrics to inform strategic decisions.

  • You are a clear and persuasive communicator, capable of influencing across all levels of the organization—including the CEO, board, and external partners. You can translate complex technical concepts into compelling narratives.

  • You understand community dynamics and how to nurture genuine connections at scale.

  • You have a strong understanding of how to design and execute go-to-market motions in early- stage environments.

  • You’re energized by solving messy, open-ended problems with clarity and structure.

WHY JOIN US?

At Arcade, you’ll get to help define the future of design, creativity, and commerce — all

while working alongside a founder with a track record of building beloved consumer

brands. You’ll join a small, driven, and collaborative team that’s passionate about creating

magical consumer experiences and empowering artists to thrive. We’re blending AI with artistry

to change the game—and we’re just getting started.

LOCATION

This is a fully on-site role, based in the San Francisco Bay Area.
